title.narrative: IR 2.5 EDUCATION

description.narrative: Country offices and partners are supported by ROSA to contribute to significant increases in the participation of more disadvantaged girls and boys in quality Early Child Development (ECD) and basic education., which contributes to Policy, Guidance And Technical Support For Country Programming And Reporting, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: ROSA will provide technical assistance, quality assurance, and oversight support for the realization of priority results for children, adolescents and women in South Asiaâ€”particularly the most disadvantagedâ€”in development and humanitarian contexts.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Country offices and partners are supported by ROSA to contribute to significant increases in the participation of moredisadvantaged girls and boys in quality ECD and basic education.

description.narrative: ROSA worked with COs to rigorously advance the reduction/prevention of OOSC through equity profiling, strengthening monitoring systems linked to high impact, cost effective quality education interventions across South Asia. This contributed to significant downwards trends in OOSC driven by India and Pakistan alongside substantive advances in early learning. | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/02/2018

title.narrative: of Key Country Programme Documents (CPD, CPAP, MTR and Emergency Preparedness and Response Key Actions)
of countries with explicit objectives on inclusive education in their national policies and/or plans
of critical education issues analysed (e.g. researched, documented) per year resulting in policies and strategies addressing out-of-school children and learning
Number of countries supported in drafting or revising education sector plans to include specific provisions on providing out-of-school children with quality education

Number of countries with well-functioning education management information systems providing disaggregated data that allow identification of barriers and bottlenecks that inhibit realization of the rights of disadvantaged children
Number of primary and lower secondary school-age children out-of-school and gender parity index
Number of countries with quality standards consistent with child-friendly school/education or similar models developed or revised
% of CO respondents satisfied with the quality of support received from ROSA on increased participation in quality ECD and basic education for disadvantaged boys and girls
% of education-related activities identified in each ROSA annual work plan (2014-2017) implemented successfully
